properties.name: from
properties.doc: Holds a reference to the user or profile which uploaded this post.

properties.name: to
properties.doc: Holds a list of references to the users or profiles which are targetted by this post.

properties.name: message
properties.doc: Holds the message text of the post.

properties.name: message_tags
properties.doc: Holds the objects tagged in the message.

properties.name: picture
properties.doc: Holds a link to the picture of the post, if available.

properties.name: link
properties.doc: Holds the link attached to this post.

properties.name: name
properties.doc: Holds the name of the link that is attached to this post.

properties.name: caption
properties.doc: Holds the caption of the link that is attached to this post.

properties.name: description
properties.doc: Holds the description of the link that is attached to this post.

properties.name: source
properties.doc: Holds the link to a video or flash movie that is embedded in this post.

properties.name: properties
properties.doc: Holds a list of properties for the attached content.

properties.name: icon
properties.doc: Holds a link to an icon representing the type of this post.

properties.name: actions
properties.doc: Holds a list of actions that can be done with this post. (not generated yet)

properties.name: privacy
properties.doc: Holds the privacy settings of this post. (not generated yet)

properties.name: type
properties.doc: Holds the type of this post.

properties.name: likes
properties.doc: Hold informations about the likes for this post. (not generated yet)

properties.name: place
properties.doc: Hold informations about the place attached to this post. (not generated yet)

properties.name: story
properties.doc: Holds the story, if this post represents a story.

properties.name: story_tags
properties.doc: Holds the objects tagged in the story.

properties.name: with_tags
properties.doc: Holds the objects or users that are tagged with the "Who are you with ?" field. (not generated yet)

properties.name: comments
properties.doc: Hold informations about the comments for this post. (not generated yet)

properties.name: object_id
properties.doc: Hold the identifier of the uploaded photo or video attached to this post.

properties.name: application
properties.doc: Hold the application that was used to upload this post.

properties.name: created_time
properties.doc: Holds the creation time of the post in an ISO8601-formatted string.

properties.name: updated_time
properties.doc: Holds the last-update time of the post in an ISO8601-formatted string.

properties.name: shares
properties.doc: Holds the number of times this post has been shared.

properties.name: include_hidden
properties.doc: Holds if this post is hidden from timeline.

properties.name: status_type
properties.doc: Hold the type of status update.

properties.name: liked
properties.doc: Whether the post has been liked by the current user.

methods.name: like
methods.doc:
Initiates a "like" operation on the post.

If the network request was started successfully, the function
will return true and the status of the post will change to
\c SocialNetwork::Busy.  Otherwise, the function will return
false.

methods.name: unlike
methods.doc:
Initiates a "delete like" operation on the post.

If the network request was started successfully, the function
will return true and the status of the post will change to
\c SocialNetwork::Busy.  Otherwise, the function will return
false.

methods.name: uploadComment
methods.doc:
Initiates a "post comment" operation on the post.  The comment
will contain the specified \a message.

If the network request was started successfully, the function
will return true and the status of the post will change to
\c SocialNetwork::Busy.  Otherwise, the function will return
false.

Once the network request completes, the \c responseReceived()
signal will be emitted.  The \c data parameter of the signal
will contain the \c id of the newly uploaded comment.

methods.name: removeComment
methods.doc:
Initiates a "delete comment" operation on the comment specified by
the given \a identifier.

If the network request was started successfully, the function
will return true and the status of the post will change to
\c SocialNetwork::Busy.  Otherwise, the function will return
false.
